page.title: 04DUNDEE - WATER ADDITIVES
page.content: In 1985 the following are added to the water supply to make it safe to drink:aluminium sulphate, sodium carbonate, Fuller's Earth (natural clay), chlorine, ammonia and sulphur dioxide. The sulphur dioxide removes nine tenths of the chlorine before the water reaches the tap. The{WATER SERVICES}are responsible for the sewerage function. The village and urban areas are served by a sewage pipe which extends into the {RIVER {TAY,}east of {INVERGOWRIE.}Much pollution is caused. Recognisable sewage is washed up on the beach making it unpleasant for the residents.Many sea-birds feed at the end of the pipe. A replacement pipe,planned for the near future, will go further out and should reduce the problem.
